text: Robert F. Coleman (November 22, 1954 - March 24, 2014) was an American mathematician and professor at the University of California, Berkeley. He worked primarily in number theory, with specific interests in p-adic analysis and arithmetic geometry. He is also known for introducing p-adic Banach spaces into the study of modular forms. Coleman died in his sleep on the night of March 24, 2014. He was 59 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * Robert F.
